page.title: 19COMMUNITY EDUCATION IN BLYTH
page.content: The Wellesley Nautical School was founded in 1868 to provide shelter for Tyneside waifs and provide trained young men for service in the Royal and Merchant Navies.The first ship was the "Cornwall" soon replaced by the battleship "Wellelsey." At the turn of the century boys were being taught seagoing trades and public services. In March 1914 the training ship was burnt. All boys and staff were brought ashore safely. Since then the school has been shorebased at the old submarine base at Blyth (except for a period during the Second World War.) Wellelsey became an Approved School in 1933. It is now one of the two Nautical Community Schools in Britain. The main courses are based on seamanship.There are also other courses to meet changing needs.
